intro: Phyllanthus decipiens var. trilocularis, commonly known as the three-chambered spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
